item.title: Reselect Last Visual Selection in Vim
item.description: Vim has three different visual modes to work with characters, lines, or rectangle blocks of text. We can switch between these modes by pressing v, V, or <ctrl-v> respectively. Many a times, we select something and press ESC by mistake, it is annoying to reselect the whole block of text again by pressing v/V. Vim provides a command gv to reselect the range of text that was selected. Command gv works for all the visual modes.
